summary: The NCAA Accountability Act of 2025 aims to establish due process requirements for investigations within intercollegiate athletics. It mandates covered athletic associations to provide detailed notices to member institutions regarding investigations, including allegations, potential penalties, and rights of the accused. The bill also outlines arbitration processes for disputes, fair investigation procedures, and reporting requirements to the Attorney General and State Attorneys General. Enforcement mechanisms include the Attorney General establishing procedures for complaints and investigations, with potential civil penalties and administrative hearings for violations.
